metadata.Title: CVE-2019-8583 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Multiple memory corruption issues were addressed with improved memory handling. This issue is fixed in iOS 12.3, macOS Mojave 10.14.5, tvOS 12.3, watchOS 5.2.1, Safari 12.1.1, iTunes for Windows 12.9.5, iCloud for Windows 7.12. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to arbitrary code execution.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-8583` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.24.1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.24.1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.24.1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.24.1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.24.1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.24.1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.24.1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: jdstrand> webkit receives limited support. For details, see https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SecurityTeam/FAQ#webkit webkit in Ubuntu uses the JavaScriptCore (JSC) engine, not V8

criterions.comment: qtwebkit-opensource-src package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
qtwebkit-source package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
webkit2gtk package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.24.1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
webkitgtk package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
